Nerangs.ab: zōt pāy ī dašn andar nihišn dast abar barsom nihišn stāomī aṣ̌əm pad barsom gōwišn barsom az barsomdān ul dārišn ud ka stāomī aṣ̌əm nē pad barsom gōwēd ātaxšgāh nōg pad pādyāb kunišn ud ka nē ranǰagīhā abastāg hamāg az pāy be aməša. spəṇta. vasasca ud ka ranǰagīhātar ēn and pāy kunišn bišāmrūt ud šnūman wizārišnīh ud wāz zōt fərastuiie az yasn [tā] imat̰ barəsma wa ahurāi mazdāi tā daϑušō tā aētat̰adim tā ān se hād ud hādān sar vaŋhuca

"The zōt has to put his right foot in, put his hand on the barsom and say staōmī aṣ̌əm next to the barsom. He has to remove it from the barsomdān. If he does not say staōmī aṣ̌əm next to the barsom, then he has to clean again the ātaxšgāh with pādyāb. If he can do it without trouble, he has to recite the whole abastāg standing, except aməša spəṇta vasasca (Y8.4-8). If it is troublesome for him, he has to stand as much as the stanzas said twice, the dedicatories and the wāz gīrišnīh and the zōt (as much as) from frastuiie (Y0.6) to imat̰ barəsma (Y2.1) and (from) ahurāi mazdāi (Y24.1) to daθušō (Y24.12) and then until aētat̰adim (Y27.1) and until these three hād, the end of the hāds: vaŋhuca (Y52)."
